title:
Phase Conventions in Hadron Physics from the Perspective of the Quark
  Model
authors: Yu Lu, Hao-Jie Jing, Jia-Jun Wu
abstract:
Convenient and consistent phase convention is important in the construction
of the hadronic Lagrangian. However, the importance of phase convention has
been overlooked for a long time and the sources of different conventions are
never explicitly addressed. This obscure situation can cause mistakes and
misinterpretations in hadron physics. In this paper, we systematically analyze
and compare the flavor $SU_3$ phase conventions from the perspective of the
quark model. All sources which could lead to different conventions are pointed
out and carefully studied. With the tool of the quark model, we also clarify
some misconceptions and demonstrate a consistent way to incorporate different
conventions.
